a.content:
Using quadratic formula, it comes down to:

P(B \leq \dfrac{1}{4A})

It will be like getting the area of this:

So

\begin{aligned} &\dfrac{1}{4} + \int_{\frac{1}{4}}^{1} \dfrac{1}{4x} dx \\ &=\dfrac{1}{4} + \dfrac{1}{4} \int_{\frac{1}{4}}^{1} \dfrac{1}{x} dx \\ &=\dfrac{1}{4} + \dfrac{1}{4} \left(\ln 1 - \ln \frac{1}{4} \right) \\ &\approx \dfrac{1}{4} + \dfrac{1}{4} \left(0 - (-1.4) \right) \\ &\approx 0.6 \end{aligned}

q.content:
You choose a point (A,B) uniformly at random in the unit square \{(x,y): x,y \in [0,1] \}

What is the probability that the equation

AX^2+X+B=0

has real solutions?
